title: Sustainability Reporting and Strategic Management: Case Study-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: Learners explore the strategic role of sustainability reporting through team-based activities and online/offline discussions, with a focus on bridging the gap between theory and practice by analyzing real corporate cases.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the mechanisms (deviation identification, action planning, accountability clarification) by which sustainability reporting contributes to strategic execution (single-loop learning).

Learners can analyze through case studies the impact of sustainability reporting on strategy formulation (double-loop learning), including criticality analysis, external benchmarking, and strategic reassessment.
Learners can conduct team projects to evaluate actual corporate sustainability reports and propose strategic improvement directions.

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (Google Workspace, Zoom, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
